page.title: 09RUDDINGTON FOOTPATHS
page.content: {Mrs. Gutteridge}has been working for the {Footpath Preservation Society} for 17 years. She makes sure that the footpaths are kept in good repair.If anyone reports an obstuction like a fallen tree or an overgrown path she writes or rings the Rushcliffe Borough Council and they send workmen to put it right. People also watch out for footpath signs that need replacing. There is a booklet called {"Walks {Around Ruddington" }costing 50p. which shows the routes of the footpaths and describes the flora and fauna that one may see. There are also six booklets produced by the {History Society} called { {"Ruddington Trails"} which describe the buildings which one can see in the village.
